issues.title: Supporting different authorisations for the sub-requests
issues.author: LanreOyewole
issues.body:
In your presentation at API Days London, you mentioned that your current design supported only one set of auth headers for the main/primary request, and all sub-requests share these same details.

You may remember that I mentioned that a large government department in the UK has an aspiration for fine-grained security, which means that a user could have different permissions on a GET (read), PUT (write), DELETE (none), for the same resource.

This approach allows reuse in a broader sense, since all the API methods can be exposed to the community, but only those that have the right tokens can perform certain operations.  You mentioned that you would consider updating your design to reflect this.
